text:
Few stories are as compelling and multifaceted as that of Simran Kaur , a health tech leader who has made it her mission to revolutionize how the industry approaches disease prevention and wellbeing. With a unique fusion of cutting-edge technology and wisdom, Kaur is creating a new chapter of healthcare — one that is both proactive and deeply human.
“My drive is to make early detection of disease a reality for everyone,” Kaur passionately states. “This mission, combined with my interest in holistic wellness, embodies my belief that the future of healthcare lies in our ability to blend the precision of science with the healing power of human connection.”
Kaur’s Unique Path To Healthcare Kaur’s journey began over a decade ago when she embarked on a pharmaceutical career. Armed with a degree in pharmacy, an MBA, and a master’s in public health, she quickly made her mark, leading successful product launches and driving growth through strategic partnerships. Her time at Foundation Medicine ignited her passion for leveraging technology to improve patient outcomes.
“Working on the launch of FoundationOne CDx, the first FDA-approved broad genomic test for all solid tumor cancer patients, opened my eyes to the incredible potential of precision medicine,” Kaur reflects. “It made me realize that by harnessing the power of genomic data, we could treat disease more effectively and catch it earlier when interventions are most successful.”
Kaur’s tenure at Anumana, where she was a founding member, testifies to her foresight in predictive medicine. Here, she led the commercialization of AI algorithms capable of predicting heart disease from electrocardiograms or ECGs, which record the electrical signals from the heart. This feat garnered an impressive $85 million in funding. Her work with medicine giants like Novartis and J&J further underscores her leadership in commercializing AI in healthcare.
Insights from her previous positions led Kaur to her current role at a UCSF startup, where she spearheads the productization of a next-generation RNA platform for early cancer detection. By enabling cancer detection through a simple blood draw, Kaur and her team are making early intervention more accessible.
The Power of Holistic Health Kaur’s skill extends beyond biotech. As her professional life progressed, she rekindled her love for breathwork and holistic health, recognizing the profound difference these practices could have on people’s lives. She envisions applying the same data-driven approach to well-being that is applied to developing healthcare interventions.
Licensed as a certified breathwork instructor and health coach, she recognizes the profound impact that stress and emotional trauma can have on our physical health. “True well-being does not only pertain to the absence of disease,” Kaur explains. “It’s about holistically nurturing the mind, body, and spirit.”
Transformational breathwork enables individuals to release stress and trauma from their bodies, empowering them to unleash a healthier, more vibrant version of themselves. Science has proven that trauma is transferred over generations through DNA, and breathwork is an established tool for unlocking and releasing that from the body. In fact, Kaur aims to pioneer the use of wearable EEG devices to measure the impact of breathwork on the brain. She envisions a new healthcare approach that honors the interconnectedness of our physical, mental, and emotional fitness.
Empowering Individuals to Thrive As the healthcare industry evolves, Kaur’s work helps those seeking a more proactive, measurable approach to mental resilience and wellbeing . Her journey is a compelling reminder that the future of healthcare is not a choice between technology and tradition but a harmonious blend of both.
“My ultimate goal is for healthcare not to be merely about treating illness, but empowering individuals to thrive,” Kaur shares. “By combining the best of science and holistic health, I believe we can transform how we approach health and unlock the full potential of human wellbeing.” With visionaries like Kaur leading the industry, that world may be closer than it seems.
